pr_title: [CALCITE-3951] Support different string comparison based on SqlCollation

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if there is a way to express String.CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER as an Expression... (for the moment using "".CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER as workaround)
timeline.author: rubenada

timeline.bodyText: Having a linq4j.tree.Expression in this level seems a bit weird. I don't remember any other class in the sql package having dependencies to linq4j. Moreover, for those projects that do not rely on Enumerable this method is a bit useless.
timeline.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText: I agree. I guess a cleaner solution would be having an EnumerableSqlCollation extends SqlCollation and having this method in there?
replies.author: rubenada

replies.bodyText: @zabetak I removed the Expression dependency and created an auxiliary method in EnumUtils to generate the expression for a certain SqlCollation's collator
replies.author: rubenada

timeline.bodyText: Is it better to return a Comparator or Collator? If we need to generate collation keys in other places then maybe the second option is preferable.
timeline.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText: Collator will give us more possibilities. Changed into Collator.
replies.author: rubenada

timeline.bodyText:
The newly added method indicate that projects should rely on inheritance to define a new collation but the documentation doesn't say so. Moreover, I get the feeling that this information is not an extension but really part of this class.
Using inheritance brings up questions like what happens with equals and hashCode? Should the comparator be part of it?
timeline.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText:
Refactored, inheritance no longer needed.
Collator is now extracted from Locale and strength (so it implicitly becomes part of the equals / hashCode)
replies.author: rubenada

replies.bodyText: Re-refactored, and back to inheritance (JavaCollation extends SqlCollation), but equals/hashCode should work fine in that case too.
replies.author: rubenada

timeline.bodyText: This test is similar to the logic of SqlOperatorBaseTest. Could we move things there? Are there things that we could reuse?
timeline.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText: SqlOperatorBaseTest is based on Sql strings, this tests requires RelBuilder (since JavaCollation cannot be extracted from sql string), so for the moment it cannot be moved there.
replies.author: rubenada

timeline.bodyText: Collations are compared with equals but is the Comparator part of the equals? Should it be?
timeline.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText: Collator is now extracted from SqlCollation's Locale and strength (so it implicitly becomes part of the equals / hashCode)
replies.author: rubenada

timeline.bodyText: Possibly we could deprecate/remove the old methods (e.g., le(String b0, String b1) and always use the new alternatives with the Comparator. When we don't have one we could use String::compareTo or Comparator.naturalOrder to have the same behavior as before.
timeline.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText: I prefer to leave them for backwards compatibility
replies.author: rubenada

timeline.bodyText: Normally we should call this method only with parameters of type String. Why do we need Object?
timeline.author: zabetak
zabetak

replies.bodyText: These methods help us to have a compact and homogeneous code in PhysTypeImpl.java, where "complex" comparator expressions can be generated, combining e.g. numeric keys (without comparator), with String keys (with comparator).
replies.author: rubenada

timeline.bodyText: The description here needs some modifications.
timeline.author: XuQianJin-Stars

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for your feedback @XuQianJin-Stars , you are right.
I have re-worked the javadoc, let me know what you think.
replies.author: rubenada

[CALCITE-3951] Support different string comparison based on SqlCollation
[CALCITE-3951] Support different string comparison based on SqlCollation
